definition: to receive/to accept/to collect/to put away/to restrain/to stop/in care of (used on address line after name)
tight/strict/close at hand/near/urgent/tense/hard up/short of money/to tighten

sentences.english: Second, local governments and enterprises are worried that the credit policy could be tightened.
sentences.chinese: 第二，地方政府和企業擔心未來信貸政策會收緊。

sentences.english: The fisherman tightens the birds' collars to keep them from swallowing their catches.
sentences.chinese: 漁夫收緊鸕鶿的脖套，防止它們吞下捕捉到的獵物。

sentences.english: So my consciousness narrows and constricts, and I'm in the "fight or flight" mode.
sentences.chinese: 我的意識變得狹窄，收緊，進入“對抗或逃跑“模式。

sentences.english: When trying a new bra, always fasten the middle or loosest hook.
sentences.chinese: 試新文胸時，要收緊中間或鬆開鉤子。

sentences.english: Tea that contains tanin can be used to tighten the membranes in the throat as well reduce itch when consumed as well.
sentences.chinese: 含有塔寧的茶水也可用於收緊喉嚨膜，減輕喉嚨癢痛。

sentences.english: Accelerated by gravity, a bird closes its wings and plunges at quarry.
sentences.chinese: 通過重力來加速，隼收緊翅膀飛向獵物。

sentences.english: The officer asked us to stand straight and keep stomach muscles in.
sentences.chinese: 長官要求我們站直並收緊腹肌。

sentences.english: Do not tense your shoulders as you do this.
sentences.chinese: 當你做這個動作時，不要收緊肩胛骨。

sentences.english: We have to suck in our bellies for a period.
sentences.chinese: 我們得收緊褲帶，過一段時間的清苦日子了。

sentences.english: Press your shoulders down and push your scapulae together. Release and repeat 15 times.
sentences.chinese: 放下肩膀收緊肩胛骨，如此重複15次。

sentences.english: Please catch in the waistline slightly.
The four screw bolts should be tightened up in turn in asymmetrically diagonal position.
sentences.chinese: 四隻螺栓要對稱地成斜對角情勢依次收緊。

sentences.english: The free end is provided with a fixing block or a poise for frapping the elastic thread.
sentences.chinese: 自由端上設有收緊彈性線的固定卡或砝碼。

sentences.english: Abdominal legs buttocks tightened, inter-ministerial body to stimulate the right side of bending.
sentences.chinese: 腹部腿部臀部收緊，跨部帶動身體向右側彎曲。

sentences.english: Several pleats on one side cinched the waist.
sentences.chinese: 身體一側的幾處褶皺收緊了腰身。

sentences.english: It needs tightening up a little.

definition: (economics) to reduce/to curtail/to cut back/to tighten/austerity/tightening/crunch
to slow/to slow down (the pace of)
to oversee/to take charge of/to supervise/to administer/supervisory/supervision
to adjust downwards/to lower (prices, wages etc)
to demote/to pass down to a lower unit
